subject: Re: [junit] When working with TestResult class of junit framework
msgSnippet: ... The protected field fListeners stores the TestListener implementations that are registered with the TestResult object. This is an instance of the Observer
messageBody:
On 05/08/05, Prasad <varaprasad_1261@...> wrote:
>
> Hi everybody,
>
> When iam using the TestResult class of junit frameworks, I came across
> a private field called fListeners.( a java.util.Vector type)
>
> What it stores ???
>
> To access that field there is a method called cloneListeners() which
> is a private method.
>
> Is there is any public method that is calling this private method ???
>
> Please give some guidance ...
>
> Thanks and Regards
> Vara Prasad
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
> ------------------------------
> YAHOO! GROUPS LINKS
>
>
> - Visit your group "junit <http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit>" on
> the web.
> - To unsubscribe from this group, send an email to:
> junit-unsubscribe@yahoogroups.com<junit-unsubscribe@yahoogroups.com?subject=Unsubscribe>
> - Your use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to the Yahoo! Terms of
> Service <http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/>.
>
>
> ------------------------------
>

The protected field fListeners stores the TestListener implementations that
are registered with the TestResult object. This is an instance of the
Observer pattern.http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?ObserverPattern
Any good IDE should show you what calls a given method - Eclipse just
displayed this to me in its Call Hierarchy View:

- startTest
- endTest
- addFailure
- addError

Regards,
James
